docs.lead_paragraph: About the Best Sellers: These lists are an expanded version of those appearing in the February 26, 2012 print edition of the Book Review, reflecting sales for the week ending February 11, 2012. An asterisk (*) indicates that a book's sales are barely distinguishable from those of the book above it. A dagger (†) indicates that some retailers report receiving bulk orders. For an explanation of our methodology, visit http://www.nytimes.com/best-sellers.

docs.lead_paragraph: Lawmakers in Virginia reversed course as citizens raised their voices in defense of women’s rights, sending conservatives a political warning.

headline.seo: Virginia Backtracks, but Not Enough, on Anti-Abortion Bill

docs.abstract: Editorial takes comfort that Virginia lawmakers, facing a public outcry, stepped back from an intrusive bill requiring women seeking abortions to undergo an ultrasound; asserts that the public's strong response sends a political warning that conservatives eager to undermine women's rights proceed at their own peril.
docs.snippet: Lawmakers in Virginia reversed course as citizens raised their voices in defense of women’s rights, sending conservatives a political warning.

docs.lead_paragraph: Readers respond to a column by Ross Douthat.
docs.snippet: Readers respond to a column by Ross Douthat.

docs.abstract: At the CNN debate in Arizona, the Republican contenders dodged a question about birth control, and accused the president of attacking religious freedom.
docs.snippet: At the CNN debate in Arizona, the Republican contenders dodged a question about birth control, and accused the president of attacking religious freedom.

headline.main: The Plight of the Pregnant Surgeon

docs.abstract: A vast majority of women surgeons reported a significant stigma attached to being pregnant, particularly during training, and females were capable of being just as dismissive as their male colleagues.
docs.snippet: A vast majority of women surgeons reported a significant stigma attached to being pregnant, particularly during training, and females were capable of being just as dismissive as their male colleagues.

docs.lead_paragraph: Parents go to Hong Kong for better medical care and lifelong residency benefits for their children, but locals are outraged over being shut out of maternity wards.

headline.seo: Mainland Chinese Flock to Hong Kong to Have Babies
headline.main: Mainland Chinese Flock to Hong Kong to Give Birth
headline.print_headline: Mainland Chinese Flock to Hong Kong to Give Birth

docs.abstract: Pregnant women from mainland China are flocking to Hong Kong to give birth, in search of better medical care and lifelong residency benefits for their children; angry locals, outraged over being shut out of their own maternity wards, are demanding a crackdown; controversy epitomizes Hong Kong's touchy relationship with the rest of China 15 years after end of British colonial rule in 1997.
docs.snippet: Parents go to Hong Kong for better medical care and lifelong residency benefits for their children, but locals are outraged over being shut out of maternity wards.

byline.contributor: Joyce Hor-Chung Lau contributed reporting from Hong Kong. Hilda Wang contributed research from Hong Kong, and Mia Li and Edy Yin from Beijing.

docs.lead_paragraph: A committee recommended that the Food and Drug Administration approve what could become the first new prescription drug to treat obesity in 13 years.

headline.seo: Qnexa Weight-Loss Drug Wins Advisory Panel’s Support
headline.main: Advisory Panel Favors Approval for Weight-Loss Drug
headline.print_headline: In Reversal, F.D.A. Panel Endorses A Diet Pill

docs.abstract: Federal committee recommends that the Food and Drug Administration approve Qnexa, what could become the first new prescription drug to treat obesity in 13 years; strongly positive vote, which was not widely expected, represents a stunning comeback for the drug and for its developer Vivus.
docs.snippet: A committee recommended that the Food and Drug Administration approve what could become the first new prescription drug to treat obesity in 13 years.

docs.lead_paragraph: New books by Richard Mason, Andromeda Romano-Lax, Niccolò Ammaniti, Lucy Ferriss, Alexander Masters and Tatiana de Rosnay.

headline.seo: New Fiction From Tatiana de Rosnay, Richard Mason and Others

docs.abstract: Susannah Meadows reviews books History of a Pleasure Seeker by Richard Mason, The Lost Daughter by Lucy Ferriss, The Detour by Andromeda Romano-Lax, Simon: The Genius in My Basement by Alexander Masters, Me and You by Niccolo Ammaniti and The House I Loved bu Tatiana de Rosnay.
docs.snippet: New books by Richard Mason, Andromeda Romano-Lax, Niccolò Ammaniti, Lucy Ferriss, Alexander Masters and Tatiana de Rosnay.

docs.lead_paragraph: Ireland's abortion policies are the strictest in Europe, but the Irish government may be about to address the previously unapproachable: whether to loosen restrictions on ending a pregnancy.

headline.main: Irish Poised to Revisit Abortion Law
headline.print_headline: Irish Poised to Revisit Abortion Law

docs.snippet: Ireland's abortion policies are the strictest in Europe, but the Irish government may be about to address the previously unapproachable: whether to loosen restrictions on ending a pregnancy.

headline.main: Who Decided That This Election Should Be About Sex?

docs.abstract: Brooks and Collins discuss the surprising role debates over contraception, abortion and unwed mothers have played so far in the campaign.
docs.snippet: Brooks and Collins discuss the surprising role debates over contraception, abortion and unwed mothers have played so far in the campaign.
